intro: Cremanthodium coriaceum, commonly known as the thick-leaved globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cremanthodium coriaceum is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, showcasing unique botanical features that aid in its survival.
